rules.natural: If the investment firm is compliant during the regulatory period, then the high-yield bond is a registered product.
Either the investment firm is compliant during the regulatory period, or the high-yield bond is a profitable product.
Either the high-yield bond has a liquid market, or if it is not the case that the high-yield bond is not profitable, then it has market volatility, which implies that it requires hedging.
Provided that the high-yield bond has restricted trading, then it has approved trading.
Under the condition that the high-yield bond has restricted trading, trading is suspended for it.
Either the high-yield bond has restricted trading, or it does not have a liquid market.
If the high-yield bond has suspended trading, then it does not have approved trading.
In the event that the high-yield bond is a new financial product, it is not a registered product.
Given that the high-yield bond is a complex product, the investment firm is not compliant during the regulatory period.
The investment firm uses algorithmic pricing, or it uses manual pricing.
In the case that the investment firm uses manual pricing, if it offers the high-yield bond, then the high-yield bond is a complex product.
If the investment firm has advanced analytics, then under the condition that it uses algorithmic pricing, should the firm offer the high-yield bond, the bond is a complex product.
Either the investment firm has advanced analytics, or it has basic analytics.
Either the analytics platform is a certified analytics tool, or it is an uncertified analytics tool.

In the event that the analytics platform is an uncertified analytics tool, then if the investment firm has basic analytics and uses algorithmic pricing, and if it offers the high-yield bond, the bond is a complex product.

Either the analytics platform has non-compliant analytics, or if it is not the case that the analytics platform being a certified analytics tool implies that with basic analytics, algorithmic pricing, and offering the high-yield bond, the bond is complex, then the analytics platform has compliant analytics.
If the trading platform is certified for the regulatory period, then it is approved for the regulatory period.
Provided that the investment firm uses an analytics tool, the high-yield bond is a profitable product.
The investment firm uses a manual method, or it uses an analytics tool.
If the investment firm has a risk assessment, then it does not use a manual method.
Should it not hold that if the investment firm offers the high-yield bond, then it is not compliant during the regulatory period, then the trading platform is certified for the regulatory period.

In the event that it is false that offering the high-yield bond by the investment firm implies non-compliance during the regulatory period, then the trading platform is not approved for the regulatory period.

Provided that the statement that a certified analytics tool implies, with basic analytics, algorithmic pricing, and offering the high-yield bond, the bond being complex, is false, then the analytics platform does not have compliant analytics.
Under the condition that it is not the case that if the investment firm fails the compliance check, then it passes the compliance check, the investment firm is under investigation.
If the implication that failing the compliance check leads to passing it is not true, then the investment firm is not under investigation.
In the event that the statement that if the high-yield bond is not profitable, then it has market volatility, is false, then the high-yield bond does not require hedging.
If the high-yield bond is not a new financial product, then it is a legacy financial product.
Provided that the high-yield bond is not a new financial product, then it is not a legacy financial product.
Should the investment firm not have a risk assessment, then it fails the compliance check.
If the investment firm does not have a risk assessment, then it does not pass the compliance check.
